Name: License requirements for newsstands.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to license requirements for newsstands.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Subchapter 7 of chapter 2 of title 20 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 20-229.1 to read as follows:
	§ 20-229.1 Notice. Within five business days of approving a newsstand license, the commissioner shall notify the affected community board and council member within whose respective district a newsstand shall be located.  
	§2.  Subdivision a of section 20-231 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:  
a. 1. No newsstand shall be within three feet of private property without the consent of the owner of that property.
2. No newsstand applying for a new license on or after March 1, 2012 shall be within twenty-five feet of any existing newsstand. 
	§3.  This local law shall take effect immediately upon its enactment.

LS# 1247 and 1243
12/7/11
JW
